LABEL: 0x2FF
STRING: I wondered if my shoes were already half-soaked in water.

LABEL: 0x335
STRING: The water temperature wasn't that cold, so it didn't make me feel that uncomfortable.

LABEL: 0x37B
STRING: But, just standing still for a moment made an unpleasant feeling crawl up my feet.

LABEL: 0x3CB
STRING: 「...The sooner we get there, the better.」

LABEL: 0x3FB
STRING: Not only because I felt unpleasant.

LABEL: 0x421
STRING: Even as we were here like this, the possibility that we would run into those creatures possessed by <COOS> was high.

LABEL: 0x48F
STRING: We'd been able to run away earlier, but there was no guarantee that we'd succeed next time.

LABEL: 0x4DB
STRING: Even the escape earlier was thanks to Tokiwa acting as a decoy...

LABEL: 0x544
STRING: 「Katagiri.」

LABEL: 0x55F
STRING: We had to hurry, for the slower we walked, the greater the danger――

LABEL: 0x5AF
STRING: Reiri, who was leading the way, beckoned me while leaning against a wall.

LABEL: 0x667
STRING: 「Boring sentimentality will have to wait for later.」

LABEL: 0x693
STRING: 「Do you understand what your role is?」

LABEL: 0x6CC
STRING: 「My role...?」

LABEL: 0x6EE
STRING: I thought back to Hiragino's words as I exposed my sins.

LABEL: 0x792
STRING: His words had felt too heavy for me back then, the one who had caused the sinking of the <SHEEP III>.

LABEL: 0x8BF
STRING: 「It's something only you can do.」

LABEL: 0x8ED
STRING: 「Will you find out what is happening on this ship?」

LABEL: 0x934
STRING: The punishment for my crime―to resolve this situation as a detective.

LABEL: 0x97A
STRING: Find the culprit.

LABEL: 0x99E
STRING: However, our situation was constantly changing.

LABEL: 0x9CE
STRING: There was no longer a culprit in this game of survival against the threat of <COOS>.

LABEL: 0xA9F
STRING: What role was there for me to play?

LABEL: 0xB98
STRING: 「Katagiri, you're my arms and legs.」

LABEL: 0xBC8
STRING: 「Arms and legs don't need to think. They just need to do as they're told.」

LABEL: 0xC13
STRING: 「...You're like a little dictator, aren't you?」

LABEL: 0xC48
STRING: 「This is just the basics of team play.」

LABEL: 0xC6E
STRING: 「The right person for the right job. Comparative advantage.」

LABEL: 0xC92
STRING: 「There's no room for personal will to intervene.」

LABEL: 0xCC8
STRING: 「If every player in the market behaves rationally――」

LABEL: 0xD18
STRING: 「Its final form will lead to a supreme dictatorship.」

LABEL: 0xD51
STRING: 「That may be true, but...」

LABEL: 0xD7F
STRING: Reiri made a valid point.

LABEL: 0xDC1
STRING: However... Was acting as her arms and legs without thinking really all I could do?

LABEL: 0xE2B
STRING: I wanted to object but ended up swallowing my words and thoughts.

LABEL: 0xE8C
STRING: 「Why don't you get what I'm trying to say...?」

LABEL: 0xECF
STRING: I looked up in surprise at her somewhat disheartened voice.

LABEL: 0xF70
STRING: Reiri stared at me with the same insolent expression as before.

LABEL: 0xFCF
STRING: 「Look, I'm telling you to carry me because I'm tired.」

LABEL: 0x100A
STRING: 「O-Oh, I see.」

LABEL: 0x1024
STRING: Her defiant words left no room for hesitation, and I offered my back to her.

LABEL: 0x107C
STRING: How many times was this now?

LABEL: 0x109E
STRING: I felt like I'd done nothing but carry her around these past few days...

LABEL: 0x1156
STRING: Reiri's ragged breaths hit my back.

LABEL: 0x1180
STRING: It had been only a short walk, but she must have been really tired.

LABEL: 0x11C0
STRING: She became like that in such a short time...

LABEL: 0x1241
STRING: Well...

LABEL: 0x1257
STRING: This wasn't the time to worry about that.

LABEL: 0x128B
STRING: 「Let's pick up the pace.」

LABEL: 0x12AD
STRING: I sped up as I told her.

LABEL: 0x12D3
STRING: Our destination was the library.

LABEL: 0x1630
STRING: The room was lined with terminals meant for browsing.

LABEL: 0x1654
STRING: For some reason, the library, with its neat rows of computers and terminals, seemed to have a certain human warmth to it.

LABEL: 0x16B4
STRING: I closed the door manually and put down Reiri, who was still on my back.

LABEL: 0x16FE
STRING: As I lowered her, I crouched down a little and leaned in to peer under a computer desk.

LABEL: 0x1752
STRING: 「I see...」

LABEL: 0x176E
STRING: The first time I visited this place was right after the accident, now that I thought about it.

LABEL: 0x1897
STRING: 「I've been found! It's game over!」

LABEL: 0x18DD
STRING: 「Now, feel free to do with me as you please!」

LABEL: 0x1916
STRING: That was my second encounter with Tokiwa, whom I had never even spoken to properly.

LABEL: 0x1962
STRING: Before that, we had met on the now-sunken observation deck.

LABEL: 0x198E
STRING: Even if it was only a short time ago, I wasn't certain what we had talked about at that time.

LABEL: 0x19F2
STRING: Other than the vivid impression she had left, the details were like a blurry, old oil painting.

LABEL: 0x1AB1
STRING: It had happened at a time when I'd still been obsessed with my plan to change the course of the <SHEEP III>.

LABEL: 0x1B0A
STRING: Still, it felt like a bad joke that it hadn't even been that long since then.

LABEL: 0x1BD1
STRING: 「Katagiri?」

LABEL: 0x1BEE
STRING: 「Ah, no... It's nothing.」

LABEL: 0x1C18
STRING: As I said that, I turned on the computer on the desk as an excuse――

LABEL: 0x1C6E
STRING: 「――Wait, there's a blackout!」

LABEL: 0x1D0C
STRING: 「You realized that just now?」

LABEL: 0x1D3D
STRING: It was like a back-and-forth from a comedy show.

LABEL: 0x1D69
STRING: 「We can't turn on the computers.」

LABEL: 0x1DA5
STRING: 「It's not like I can program through telekinesis. What am I supposed to do?」

LABEL: 0x1DF5
STRING: I complained with exaggerated gestures, trying to get back at her for earlier.

LABEL: 0x1E9F
STRING: 「A PC certainly can't be operated if the power is out.」

LABEL: 0x1EDB
STRING: 「But the PDAs should still be charged.」

LABEL: 0x1F11
STRING: 「Huh?」

LABEL: 0x1F93
STRING: 「Didn't I tell you, Katagiri?」

LABEL: 0x1FC4
STRING: Was this her plan all along...?

LABEL: 0x2004
STRING: The fact that there was no power should be obvious if you thought about it.

LABEL: 0x2078
STRING: 「I told you I could do it, but...」

LABEL: 0x20A0
STRING: I reached for a PDA as I spoke.

LABEL: 0x20CB
STRING: I thought it would be easy enough to hack via a PC, but it was a different story if she wanted me to directly operate this thing.

LABEL: 0x213F
STRING: It was the first time I'd held one since boarding the <SHEEP III>.

LABEL: 0x2174
STRING: However, the system running inside was very different――

LABEL: 0x21B6
STRING: As long as I could get into administrator mode, I'd be all set.

LABEL: 0x21F5
STRING: I turned the PDA on and managed to get to the system settings screen with little trouble.

LABEL: 0x223D
STRING: Okay, here we go――

LABEL: 0x225B
STRING: 「I give up.」

LABEL: 0x22DF
STRING: 「It hasn't even been a minute, you sissy.」

LABEL: 0x2306
STRING: 「Even Touri would be able to hold out for at least three minutes... Are you saying she's better than you?」

LABEL: 0x2356
STRING: 「Don't say that with a straight face.」

LABEL: 0x2374
STRING: What do you think your sister is, anyway?

LABEL: 0x23AE
STRING: I handed the PDA in my hand to her.

LABEL: 0x2434
STRING: 「The administrative privileges are locked.」

LABEL: 0x2464
STRING: 「With no ID and password, it's impossible to program it.」

LABEL: 0x24B0
STRING: 「I think it would be better if we figured out how to power the PCs――」

LABEL: 0x2550
STRING: 「Here.」

LABEL: 0x256B
STRING: Reiri tossed the PDA back to me.

LABEL: 0x259E
STRING: That was no way to treat electronics...

LABEL: 0x25EA
STRING: 「Did you give up too?」

LABEL: 0x267E
STRING: 「I unlocked it.」

LABEL: 0x26A5
STRING: 「What?」

LABEL: 0x26D5
STRING: I looked at the PDA in my hand.

LABEL: 0x26F8
STRING: It was on the home screen... The authentication screen was already closed.

LABEL: 0x2736
STRING: And, there was an icon there indicating that the device was in administrator mode.

LABEL: 0x2786
STRING: 「How the...」

LABEL: 0x27A6
STRING: How did she get into admin mode?

LABEL: 0x27DA
STRING: No, how exactly did she know the administrator password?

LABEL: 0x2822
STRING: ...Now wasn't the time to get distracted by that.

LABEL: 0x2862
STRING: At any rate, I had administrator access now.

LABEL: 0x2890
STRING: All that was left was...

LABEL: 0x2914
STRING: 「The rest is up to you.」

LABEL: 0x293B
STRING: 「I know... Just wait and see.」

LABEL: 0x2963
STRING: The poor usability of the on-screen keyboard was on a criminal level, but...

LABEL: 0x29B1
STRING: I wasn't the kind of person who got bothered by such things.

LABEL: 0x29F5
STRING: 「Reiri, the data.」

LABEL: 0x2A24
STRING: 「Here.」

LABEL: 0x2A43
STRING: She handed me a dongle.

LABEL: 0x2A8D
STRING: I connected it to the PDA and opened the data.

LABEL: 0x2ACA
STRING: A formula was displayed on the screen... Right, this was...

LABEL: 0x2B02
STRING: 「Is this the formula for the light pattern?」

LABEL: 0x2B9A
STRING: 「Yeah. It's a reproduction of <COOS> I made.」

LABEL: 0x2BD4
STRING: 「If you program them using it...」

LABEL: 0x2C05
STRING: 「Leave it to me.」

LABEL: 0x2C1D
STRING: 「I'll reset the zero moment point and CPG while taking the calibration...」

LABEL: 0x2CE4
STRING: 「Are you the type of nerd who can't hit the keyboard without getting into character?」

LABEL: 0x2D41
STRING: 「No, I was just trying to lighten the mood...」

LABEL: 0x2D7C
STRING: 「It's rare for someone's concern to be this unnecessary.」

LABEL: 0x2DE9
STRING: I didn't have the heart of steel required to continue talking after hearing that.

LABEL: 0x2E53
STRING: The only sound in the silent room was my fingers tapping on the screen.

LABEL: 0x2EA1
STRING: It only took a few minutes for me to get the hang of it and get most of the programming done.

LABEL: 0x2EE7
STRING: 「Okay, it's done.」

LABEL: 0x2F1C
STRING: I restarted the PDA in my hand, and the screen glowed ominously.

LABEL: 0x2F61
STRING: It was just like <COOS>, wasn't it...?

LABEL: 0x2FEA
STRING: Had Reiri really analyzed and reproduced it all by herself...?

LABEL: 0x302A
STRING: As my eyes were drawn to that bewitching light, Reiri opened her mouth.

LABEL: 0x30DA
STRING: 「First things first.」

LABEL: 0x30FC
STRING: 「We need to embed the same light pattern in all the remaining PDAs.」

LABEL: 0x314A
STRING: 「In all of them...?」

LABEL: 0x3180
STRING: I looked up from the screen.

LABEL: 0x31A8
STRING: At least a few dozen devices were visible in the dimly lit library.

LABEL: 0x31F4
STRING: All of them needed to be programmed...?

LABEL: 0x3224
STRING: I despaired.

LABEL: 0x3249
STRING: 「Don't worry.」

LABEL: 0x3268
STRING: She tossed me a dongle as she reassured me.

LABEL: 0x329C
STRING: ...How many of these did she have?

LABEL: 0x32DC
STRING: The <SHEEP III> was a stand-alone environment that went against the current social cloud era.

LABEL: 0x3339
STRING: The data was isolated from the network... And Reiri was carrying all this information and knowledge with her.

LABEL: 0x3385
STRING: Was she normally this well equipped to operate in a submarine like this?

LABEL: 0x33E7
STRING: 「What's in it?」

LABEL: 0x3407
STRING: I plugged it in without waiting for an answer, and when I tried to open the data...

LABEL: 0x3443
STRING: The PDA vibrated, displaying an error message.

LABEL: 0x34FD
STRING: 「This data is safe to open, right?」

LABEL: 0x359F
STRING: 「What? It's just a virus program.」

LABEL: 0x35D6
STRING: 「What do you mean, "just"...?」

LABEL: 0x35FC
STRING: There's nothing "just" about viruses.

LABEL: 0x369C
STRING: 「We'll use this virus to infect all the PDAs here with the same program.」

LABEL: 0x36F1
STRING: 「The virus itself only breaks through security and doesn't do anything more than that.」

LABEL: 0x3745
STRING: 「It's a vector virus, in other words.」

LABEL: 0x37A0
STRING: Just to be sure...

LABEL: 0x37BA
STRING: I tried looking inside the virus program out of habit.

LABEL: 0x3860
STRING: 「Don't do that.」

LABEL: 0x387C
STRING: 「It's a waste of time.」

LABEL: 0x389F
STRING: 「...You made this?」

LABEL: 0x3931
STRING: 「Who knows?」

LABEL: 0x394E
STRING: Reiri answered shamelessly.

LABEL: 0x39D8
STRING: 「That should do it.」

LABEL: 0x3A01
STRING: She pulled the dongle from the first PDA and plugged it into another one placed beside it.

LABEL: 0x3A55
STRING: After a few seconds, the screen started to glow in the same pattern as the first PDA.

LABEL: 0x3AD1
STRING: 「That should make it easier.」

LABEL: 0x3B1E
STRING: She then hopped onto a computer desk and sat down.

LABEL: 0x3B64
STRING: It looked like she had no intention of moving from there.

LABEL: 0x3B9E
STRING: I took the dongle and inserted it into the next PDA.

LABEL: 0x3BF1
STRING: Once this was "infected," I'd move on to the next one...

LABEL: 0x3C3E
STRING: 「Katagiri.」

LABEL: 0x3C59
STRING: 「...What?」

LABEL: 0x3CA6
STRING: 「Do you think there's a difference between a natural "virus" and a "virus" program?」

LABEL: 0x3D01
STRING: As I frantically moved around and collected the PDAs, her voice called out from behind me.

LABEL: 0x3D52
STRING: A hoarse whispering voice... One you would miss if you didn't listen carefully.

LABEL: 0x3E05
STRING: 「Didn't you tell me to keep quiet while working?」

LABEL: 0x3EAB
STRING: 「You misunderstood. It's because of your sense of inferiority that you interpreted it that way.」

LABEL: 0x3F16
STRING: What did I do to deserve this...?

LABEL: 0x3F4A
STRING: I was starting to understand what Touri had to constantly deal with.

LABEL: 0x3F7D
STRING: 「Some people say the difference is whether it's a living thing or not.」

LABEL: 0x3FB9
STRING: 「A living virus, or a program virus.」

LABEL: 0x405E
STRING: 「If you look at it from a naive perspective like that, it sounds right. What do you think, Katagiri?」

LABEL: 0x40AF
STRING: 「...Viruses aren't living things.」

LABEL: 0x40DB
STRING: In general, viruses were not considered living organisms.

LABEL: 0x4119
STRING: They were mechanical structures composed of nucleic acids and a protein shell that surrounded them.

LABEL: 0x4167
STRING: Although they had the ability to self-replicate, they didn't fulfill the requirements of a living organism, as they didn't have cells.

LABEL: 0x4233
STRING: 「Some people say it's the presence or absence of physical substance.」

LABEL: 0x426B
STRING: 「A natural follow up on the dichotomy we just discussed.」

LABEL: 0x42AF
STRING: 「It's difficult to try and deny it.」

LABEL: 0x42E6
STRING: A virus that physically existed, and a virus that was nothing more than data.

LABEL: 0x432A
STRING: This dichotomy was, as Reiri said, hard to refute.

LABEL: 0x437F
STRING: 「Physical substance... They might be right on that one.」

LABEL: 0x43CC
STRING: 「Do you have a problem with it?」

LABEL: 0x4409
STRING: 「If you want me to tell you the difference between a natural "virus" and a "virus" program...」

LABEL: 0x4465
STRING: 「Then that might be the right answer.」

LABEL: 0x44F4
STRING: 「But... Is that really substantive?」

LABEL: 0x4531
STRING: 「Substantive?」

LABEL: 0x4549
STRING: For a moment, my hands stopped what they were doing.

LABEL: 0x4582
STRING: 「Can we say that they're different simply because of the difference in their physical reality?」

LABEL: 0x460E
STRING: 「The reality of a virus lies in its information.」

LABEL: 0x463C
STRING: 「So, is it the difference in their medium, silicon or RNA?」

LABEL: 0x4682
STRING: A virus possessed information.

LABEL: 0x46A4
STRING: It was a program that continued to replicate itself.

LABEL: 0x46D0
STRING: If it didn't matter what the medium was, then where was the difference between the two?

LABEL: 0x4741
STRING: 「The words of the ancient prophets, the laws of God, were repeatedly reproduced through the medium of paper.」

LABEL: 0x4791
STRING: 「We're still doing the same thing, essentially.」

LABEL: 0x47DD
STRING: 「It's just that the medium changed, along with the scale and speed.」

LABEL: 0x4821
STRING: 「The infection won't end.」

LABEL: 0x4873
STRING: 「...I'm done.」

LABEL: 0x48AB
STRING: The last PDA lit up.

LABEL: 0x48CE
STRING: The library was now filled with flickering PDAs.

LABEL: 0x4905
STRING: While we hadn't been able to reproduce the otherworldly colors of <COOS>, this was close enough.

LABEL: 0x4965
STRING: The light they emitted was mysterious and fascinating...

LABEL: 0x49A7
STRING: Even though I knew it was artificial, I had a hard time taking my eyes off them...

LABEL: 0x4A04
STRING: 「――Katagiri.」

LABEL: 0x4A1E
STRING: 「Don't look too closely.」

LABEL: 0x4A55
STRING: 「R-Right...」

LABEL: 0x4A73
STRING: I had thought of it as just a light pattern.

LABEL: 0x4AA7
STRING: But, this was <COOS>...

LABEL: 0x4B26
STRING: 「...What are we going to do now?」

LABEL: 0x4B63
STRING: 「For now, the PDAs should be fine right here.」

LABEL: 0x4BA6
STRING: 「There's one more place I want to visit.」

LABEL: 0x4BDD
STRING: 「And where's that?」

LABEL: 0x4BFF
STRING: She nodded without looking at me as I asked.

LABEL: 0x4C42
STRING: 「Take me to the laboratory.」

LABEL: 0x4CF0
STRING: When I stepped out into the hallway, I confirmed that there were no shadows on either side, then crouched down.

LABEL: 0x4D48
STRING: Surprised, Reiri smiled a little.

LABEL: 0x4DE2
STRING: 「What do you think you're doing?」

LABEL: 0x4E0B
STRING: 「It's already dangerous as it is. If we go to the lower floors, there'll be more water.」

LABEL: 0x4E4F
STRING: 「I'm not confident we'll be able to escape if you're there walking next to me.」

LABEL: 0x4E95
STRING: 「And, it's simply faster if I run.」

LABEL: 0x4EDE
STRING: 「I see.」

LABEL: 0x4EFD
STRING: 「To the laboratory, then.」

LABEL: 0x4F3B
STRING: I started running while carrying Reiri on my back.

LABEL: 0x5285
STRING: The laboratory.

LABEL: 0x529B
STRING: It was still fresh in my memory that Reiri had done something here earlier.

LABEL: 0x52DB
STRING: No one should have been here since then.

LABEL: 0x530F
STRING: Reiri rearranged the petri dishes on the desk with familiar movements.

LABEL: 0x53D0
STRING: 「Let's continue where we left off.」

LABEL: 0x5401
STRING: 「Where we left off?」

LABEL: 0x542E
STRING: 「The difference between a virus and a computer virus.」

LABEL: 0x546D
STRING: We hadn't reached a conclusion on the subject yet.

LABEL: 0x5499
STRING: That said, it had been just her talking one-sidedly...

LABEL: 0x54E1
STRING: 「Is there any other difference besides their physical reality?」

LABEL: 0x551F
STRING: 「Something more "substantive?"」

LABEL: 0x5552
STRING: 「Yes.」

LABEL: 0x556D
STRING: She readily affirmed it.

LABEL: 0x5593
STRING: As if it were a simple matter, Reiri continued.

LABEL: 0x5631
STRING: 「The presence or absence of malice.」

LABEL: 0x565C
STRING: 「Malice...?」

LABEL: 0x5687
STRING: 「Computer viruses are malicious in origin.」

LABEL: 0x56C5
STRING: 「Or, goodwill.」

LABEL: 0x56EC
STRING: Malice or goodwill.

LABEL: 0x570C
STRING: A person's will to do something to others, and their feelings.

LABEL: 0x574A
STRING: Man-made computer viruses were certainly created because of someone's goodwill or malice.

LABEL: 0x581C
STRING: 「However, natural viruses don't harbor any value standards.」

LABEL: 0x5860
STRING: 「Even if a virus infects animals or plants and kills them in the process, it's only a side effect.」

LABEL: 0x58C0
STRING: 「――A side effect to accomplish their primary goal of self-replication.」

LABEL: 0x5902
STRING: 「Computer viruses, however, are created with the goal of destroying.」

LABEL: 0x594C
STRING: 「Self-replication is a means to that end.」

LABEL: 0x597B
STRING: Natural viruses could kill for the sake of self-replication.

LABEL: 0x59BB
STRING: A virus program replicated itself for the sake of destroying something.

LABEL: 0x5A01
STRING: I see. There seemed to be a clear difference there.

LABEL: 0x5A41
STRING: I could see it, but...

LABEL: 0x5A5B
STRING: 「Malice, huh?」

LABEL: 0x5A84
STRING: 「Do you disagree?」

LABEL: 0x5AAB
STRING: 「Let's say someone makes a computer virus out of harmless mischievousness.」

LABEL: 0x5AF9
STRING: 「Ebola alone killed over ten thousand people.」

LABEL: 0x5B2A
STRING: 「I just can't see how the former is more "evil" than the latter.」

LABEL: 0x5BDE
STRING: 「I see.」

LABEL: 0x5BFD
STRING: Reiri cleared her throat with a small laugh.

LABEL: 0x5C34
STRING: 「Malice and evil are two different concepts. Don't confuse the two.」

LABEL: 0x5C70
STRING: 「Whether the virus is malicious or not...」

LABEL: 0x5CAA
STRING: 「It's up to humans to call the disaster it creates, the act it does, evil.」

LABEL: 0x5D7F
STRING: 「Then again――」

LABEL: 0x5D9D
STRING: 「No one can say for sure that a virus has no malice.」

LABEL: 0x5DF4
STRING: It wasn't human, so there was no way to know if it harbored malicious intent.

LABEL: 0x5E2C
STRING: Reiri muttered.

LABEL: 0x5E6E
STRING: But even when it came to humans, there was no such thing as a way to measure malice...

LABEL: 0x5EB0
STRING: All we could do was believe their word.

LABEL: 0x5EEA
STRING: The will behind those words――

LABEL: 0x5F14
STRING: 「...Reiri――」

LABEL: 0x5F34
STRING: 「Why did you want to get on this ship?」

LABEL: 0x5F6C
STRING: The question came out of my mouth naturally.

LABEL: 0x600A
STRING: To grant Touri's wish――

LABEL: 0x6032
STRING: Her sister had said so, but I didn't find it very likely that Reiri would go to such lengths for Touri...

LABEL: 0x6094
STRING: The difference between a virus and a computer virus was the will behind it.

LABEL: 0x60E6
STRING: So, what was Reiri's will behind talking about such things?

LABEL: 0x61BC
STRING: The corners of her mouth curled into a grin in response to my question.

LABEL: 0x6264
STRING: 「I see... Katagiri.」

LABEL: 0x6288
STRING: 「――Do you like aquariums?」

LABEL: 0x6339
STRING: 「Aquariums, or even zoos...」

LABEL: 0x636C
STRING: She spoke up.

LABEL: 0x6388
STRING: I was left speechless at the sudden change of topic.

LABEL: 0x63C4
STRING: Her intention was lost on me――

LABEL: 0x63F9
STRING: 「An aquarium is a more obvious example, I guess...」

LABEL: 0x642F
STRING: 「The fish are placed there in a calculated manner, like in interior design.」

LABEL: 0x646D
STRING: 「You can say bad things about their management all you want, but what about the reality of the situation?」

LABEL: 0x64B9
STRING: 「They get adequate nutrition, are protected from the outside world, and sometimes are even provided with a mate.」

LABEL: 0x6511
STRING: 「What more could they desire?」

LABEL: 0x65DE
STRING: 「But, their lifespans are shorter than if they were in their natural environment.」

LABEL: 0x667D
STRING: 「Why do you think that is?」

LABEL: 0x66A2
STRING: A controlled life.

LABEL: 0x66C0
STRING: An environment where one could live the life they'd been given without any inconveniences.

LABEL: 0x6704
STRING: What did this have to do with why she was on the <SHEEP III>...?

LABEL: 0x675A
STRING: 「I'm just another being to be kept.」

LABEL: 0x678E
STRING: 「By that man――」

LABEL: 0x67B5
STRING: That man...?

LABEL: 0x67CF
STRING: Who was she talking about in a bitter tone like that...?

LABEL: 0x686F
STRING: 「Now then... Time's up.」

LABEL: 0x6898
STRING: 「Huh?」

LABEL: 0x691A
STRING: 「I said I'm done.」

LABEL: 0x6945
STRING: 「Wha... Already?」

LABEL: 0x696F
STRING: Had she finished her work during this series of questions?

LABEL: 0x69AF
STRING: Reiri turned around, satisfied.

LABEL: 0x6A41
STRING: 「I've done what I came here to do. I've no more business here.」

LABEL: 0x6AD0
STRING: 「As for the answer to your earlier question... It'll be homework.」

LABEL: 0x6B1F
STRING: She smiled while holding several test tubes in her hands.

LABEL: 0x6B5B
STRING: There were rubber plugs on them, but I could see colorless, transparent liquid inside.

LABEL: 0x6BA7
STRING: 「And those are...?」

LABEL: 0x6BD4
STRING: 「Oh, just something I need.」

LABEL: 0x6BFF
STRING: Her words sounded suggestive.

LABEL: 0x6C23
STRING: She said nothing more and put them away in her pocket.

LABEL: 0x6CC5
STRING: 「Come, let's return――」

LABEL: 0x6CE7
STRING: 「There's still a lot left to do.」
